meanings.definition: Entice or persuade someone to do something they may regret.
meanings.sent1: She tried to tempt her friend with a piece of chocolate cake.
meanings.sent2: The shiny object on the table tempted him to touch it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tempted the dog by running around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden fruit hanging from the tree tempted Eve to take a bite.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of freshly baked cookies tempted everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: Attract or allure someone to do something, especially something morally wrong.
meanings.sent1: The thief tried to tempt the young boy into stealing candy from the store.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious stranger's offer tempted her to break the law.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tempted the birds by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley tempted him to take a shortcut, even though it was dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The idea of cheating on the test tempted her, but she resisted the urge.

meanings.definition: To provoke or incite someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: His teasing remarks were meant to tempt his brother into a playful wrestling match.
meanings.sent2: The loud music tempted the neighbors to call the police.
meanings.sent3: The tempting smell of popcorn tempted the moviegoers to buy a large bucket.
meanings.sent4: The exciting adventure story tempted her to plan a spontaneous trip.
meanings.sent5: The challenging puzzle tempted him to test his problem-solving skills.
